required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-masked, Sham-controlled Phase 3b/4 Study of the Efficacy, Safety, and Tolerability of Intravitreal Aflibercept Monotherapy Compared to Aflibercept With Adjunctive Photodynamic Therapy as Indicated in Subjects With Polypoidal Choroidal Vasculopathy

brief_summary.textblock: To collect data reflecting the efficacy and safety of aflibercept with and without photodynamic therapy in subjects diagnosed with the polypoidal choroidal vasculopathy subtype of wet age-related macular degeneration

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change in Best Corrected Visual Acuity (BCVA) as Measured by Early Treatment of Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) Letter Scores From Baseline to Week 52 - Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF)
primary_outcome.description: Visual function of the study eye and fellow eye was assessed at each study visit according to the standard procedure developed for the ETDRS adapted for Age Related Eye Disease Study (AREDS), using 70 letter charts at a starting distance of 4 meters. Participants were challenged with reading letters on lines of an eye chart (5 letters per line). Lines became smaller as participants progressed from the top to the bottom of the chart. Participants read down the chart until they reached a row where a minimum of three letters on a line could be read, and were scored by how many letters could be correctly identified.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Who Avoided at Least 15 Letters Loss in ETDRS at Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: Visual function of the study eye and fellow eye was assessed at each study visit according to the standard procedure developed for the ETDRS adapted for Age Related Eye Disease Study (AREDS), using 70 letter charts at a starting distance of 4 meters. Participants were challenged with reading letters on lines of an eye chart (5 letters per line). Lines became smaller as participants progressed from the top to the bottom of the chart. Participants read down the chart until they reached a row where a minimum of three letters on a line could be read, and were scored by how many letters could be correctly identified.

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Who Never Need Rescue Therapy in the First Year
other_outcome.description: Evaluations for qualification for rescue were conducted at each visit from Week 12 to Week 52. Intensified aflibercept treatment plus active or sham PDT treatments were given at any of these visits if treatment criteria were met. Qualification for rescue was based upon insufficient gain of BCVA, leakage, and presence of active polyps.

other_outcome.measure: Number of PDT Treatments in the Study Eye Before Week 52
Number of Aflibercept Treatments in the Study Eye (After Randomization) Before Week 52
Time to First Administration of PDT in the Study Eye Before Week 52
Change of Visual Acuity (Letters) From Baseline Over Time (Week) in the Study Eye
other_outcome.description: Visual function of the study eye and fellow eye was assessed at each study visit according to the standard procedure developed for the ETDRS adapted for Age Related Eye Disease Study (AREDS), using 70 letter charts at a starting distance of 4 meters. Participants were challenged with reading letters on lines of an eye chart (5 letters per line). Lines became smaller as participants progressed from the top to the bottom of the chart. Participants read down the chart until they reached a row where a minimum of three letters on a line could be read, and were scored by how many letters could be correctly identified.

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Who Gained ≥5, 10, or 15 Letters at Week 52
other_outcome.description: Visual function of the study eye and fellow eye was assessed at each study visit according to the standard procedure developed for the ETDRS adapted for Age Related Eye Disease Study (AREDS), using 70 letter charts at a starting distance of 4 meters. Participants were challenged with reading letters on lines of an eye chart (5 letters per line). Lines became smaller as participants progressed from the top to the bottom of the chart. Participants read down the chart until they reached a row where a minimum of three letters on a line could be read, and were scored by how many letters could be correctly identified.

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Who Lost ≥5, 10, or 15 Letters at Week 52
other_outcome.description: Visual function of the study eye and fellow eye was assessed at each study visit according to the standard procedure developed for the ETDRS adapted for Age Related Eye Disease Study (AREDS), using 70 letter charts at a starting distance of 4 meters. Participants were challenged with reading letters on lines of an eye chart (5 letters per line). Lines became smaller as participants progressed from the top to the bottom of the chart. Participants read down the chart until they reached a row where a minimum of three letters on a line could be read, and were scored by how many letters could be correctly identified.

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With Complete Polyp Regression at Week 52
other_outcome.description: Complete polyp regression was defined as absent or indeterminate visual polyps on Indocyanine green angiography (ICGA) in the study eye.

other_outcome.measure: Change of Leakage Area in Fluorescein Angiography (FA) in the Study Eye at Week 52
other_outcome.description: Leakage is the release of fluorescein dye from diseased retinal vessels. Leakage area is defined as the area showing presence of fluorescein dye in the late stages of fluorescein angiography.

other_outcome.measure: Change of Central Subfield Thickness (CST) on Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT) From Baseline to Week 52
other_outcome.description: Retinal and lesion characteristics, such as central retinal thickness (CRT), were evaluated by OCT in both eyes at every study visit. CRT was measured using optical coherence tomography to determine the average thickness of the retina in a circle with 1 millimeter of diameter centered on the fovea. This value is reported by some OCT devices as central subfield thickness (CST).

other_outcome.measure: Change in National Eye Institute 25-item Visual Function Questionnaire (NEI VFQ-25) Total Score From Baseline to Week 52
other_outcome.description: The NEI VFQ-25 total score ranges from 0-100 with a score of 0 being the worst outcome and 100 being the best outcome. The NEI VFQ questionnaire is organized as a collection of subscales which are all scored from 0-100. To reach the overall composite score, each sub-scale score is averaged in order to give each sub-scale equal weight.

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects for Whom Rescue Therapy is Indicated Over the Course Till Week 52
other_outcome.description: Evaluations for qualification for rescue were conducted at each visit from Week 12 to Week 52. Intensified aflibercept treatment plus active or sham PDT treatments were given at any of these visits if treatment criteria were met. Qualification for rescue was based upon insufficient gain of BCVA, leakage, and presence of active polyps.

arm_group.description: Participants received 2 milligram (mg) Intravitreal aflibercept injection (IAI) (Eylea, VEGF Trap-Eye, BAY86-5321) every month for the first 3 months (run-in period). At Week 12, subjects were randomized to receive Aflibercept injection plus sham photodynamic therapy (only in subjects qualifying for rescue therapy)

Participants received 2 mg Intravitreal aflibercept injection (IAI) (Eylea, VEGF Trap-Eye, BAY86-5321) every month for the first 3 months (run-in period). At Week 12, subjects were randomized to receive Aflibercept injection plus active photodynamic therapy (only in subjects qualifying for rescue therapy)

intervention.description: Eylea is administered as an intravitreal injection
Photodynamic therapy is a combined therapy of drug (Visudyne) applied to reinforce the action of a device (laser)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Signed informed consent
- Men and women ≥50 years of age
- Diagnosis of symptomatic macular Polypoidal Choroidal Vasculopathy (PCV) in the study eye established by Indocyanine Green Angiography(ICGA) at the study center
- Greatest linear dimension of the lesion of < 5400 mm (approximately, 9 Macular Photocoagulation Study disk areas), assessed by ICGA.
- An Early treatment diabetic retinopathy study (ETDRS) BCVA of 73 to 24 letters in the study eye.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior use of intravitreal or sub-tenon corticosteroids in the study eye within 3 months prior to study entry
- Any prior use of intraocular anti Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor (anti-VEGF)agents in the study eye, or systemic use of anti VEGF products within 3 months prior to study entry
- Prior macular laser treatment in the study eye including Photodynamic Therapy (PDT)
- History of allergy to fluorescein used in fluorescein angiography, iodine and/or indocyanine green.
- History of allergy to aflibercept, verteporfin, or their excipients.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study was conducted at multiple centers in 8 countries worldwide starting from 29 May 2014 (first subject first visit). Primary completion reached on 12 Aug 2016.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Overall, 428 subjects were screened, of them 95 were failed in screening. Remaining 333 subjects received at least one treatment. Of them, 15 subjects discontinued study participation before week 12 and were not randomized. Remaining 318 were randomized.

group.title: Aflibercept + Sham Photodynamic Therapy (PDT)
group.description: Participants received 2 milligram (mg) Intravitreal aflibercept injection (IAI) (Eylea, VEGF Trap-Eye, BAY86-5321) every month for the first 3 months (run-in period). At Week 12, subjects were randomized to receive Aflibercept injection plus sham photodynamic therapy (only in subjects qualifying for rescue therapy).

group.title: Aflibercept + Active PDT
group.description: Participants received 2 mg Intravitreal aflibercept injection (IAI) (Eylea, VEGF Trap-Eye, BAY86-5321) every month for the first 3 months (run-in period). At Week 12, subjects were randomized to receive Aflibercept injection plus active photodynamic therapy (only in subjects qualifying for rescue therapy) until Week 52. Between Week 52 and Week 96, the treatment interval could have been extended (typically in increments of 1 or 2 weeks) at the discretion of the investigator when the visual and anatomic outcomes allowed

group.title: Aflibercept (Non-randomized)
group.description: Participants received 2 mg Intravitreal aflibercept injection (IAI) (Eylea, VEGF Trap-Eye, BAY86-5321) every month for the first 3 months (run-in period), but discontinued study participation before randomization

baseline.population: Baseline characteristics is reported in Full analysis set which included all randomized subjects (N=318).

analysis.estimate_desc: Point estimate, 95% CI and p-value are based on treatment difference (AFL-sham – AFL-PDT) of the LS mean changes using an ANOVA model with treatment group and ethnicity and qualification for rescue therapy at Week 12 as fixed effects.

analysis.method_desc: The p-value is calculated from the 2-sided Cochran-Mantel-Haenszel test adjusted by ethnicity and qualification for rescue therapy at Week 12
analysis.estimate_desc: CI is based on the treatment difference in % (AFL-sham – AFL-PDT) using the Mantel-Haenszel weighting scheme adjusted by ethnicity and qualification for rescue therapy at Week 12

analysis.method_desc: The p-value is calculated from the 2-sided Cochran-Mantel-Haenszel test adjusted by ethnicity and qualification for rescue therapy at Week 12
analysis.estimate_desc: CI is based on the treatment difference in % (AFL-sham – AFL-PDT) using the Mantel-Haenszel weighting scheme adjusted by ethnicity and qualification for rescue therapy at Week 12

group.title: Aflibercept + Active PDT
group.description: Participants received 2 mg Intravitreal aflibercept injection (IAI) (Eylea, VEGF Trap-Eye, BAY86-5321) every month for the first 3 months (run-in period). At Week 12, subjects were randomized to receive Aflibercept injection plus active photodynamic therapy (only in subjects qualifying for rescue therapy) until Week 52. Between Week 52 and Week 96, the treatment interval could have been extended (typically in increments of 1 or 2 weeks) at the discretion of the investigator when the visual and anatomic outcomes allowed

measure.title: Percentage of Subjects With Complete Polyp Regression at Week 52
measure.description: Complete polyp regression was defined as absent or indeterminate visual polyps on Indocyanine green angiography (ICGA) in the study eye.
measure.population: FAS with evaluable subjects for this outcome measure.

analysis.method_desc: The p-value is calculated from the 2-sided Cochran-Mantel-Haenszel test adjusted by ethnicity and qualification for rescue therapy at Week 12
analysis.estimate_desc: CI is based on the treatment difference in % (AFL-sham – AFL-PDT) using the Mantel-Haenszel weighting scheme adjusted by ethnicity and qualification for rescue therapy at Week 12

outcome.title: Change of Leakage Area in Fluorescein Angiography (FA) in the Study Eye at Week 52
outcome.description: Leakage is the release of fluorescein dye from diseased retinal vessels. Leakage area is defined as the area showing presence of fluorescein dye in the late stages of fluorescein angiography.
outcome.population: FAS with evaluable subjects for this outcome measure.

group.title: Aflibercept + Sham Photodynamic Therapy (PDT)
group.description: Participants received 2 milligram (mg) Intravitreal aflibercept injection (IAI) (Eylea, VEGF Trap-Eye, BAY86-5321) every month for the first 3 months (run-in period). At Week 12, subjects were randomized to receive Aflibercept injection plus sham photodynamic therapy (only in subjects qualifying for rescue therapy).

group.title: Aflibercept + Active PDT
group.description: Participants received 2 mg Intravitreal aflibercept injection (IAI) (Eylea, VEGF Trap-Eye, BAY86-5321) every month for the first 3 months (run-in period). At Week 12, subjects were randomized to receive Aflibercept injection plus active photodynamic therapy (only in subjects qualifying for rescue therapy) until Week 52. Between Week 52 and Week 96, the treatment interval could have been extended (typically in increments of 1 or 2 weeks) at the discretion of the investigator when the visual and anatomic outcomes allowed

measure.title: Change of Leakage Area in Fluorescein Angiography (FA) in the Study Eye at Week 52
measure.description: Leakage is the release of fluorescein dye from diseased retinal vessels. Leakage area is defined as the area showing presence of fluorescein dye in the late stages of fluorescein angiography.
measure.population: FAS with evaluable subjects for this outcome measure.

analysis.groups_desc: The analysis population included only subjects with leakage in FA at baseline and Week 52. Baseline values were not carried forward.
analysis.estimate_desc: Point estimate, 95% CI and p-value are based on difference (AFL-sham – AFL-PDT) of LS mean changes using an ANCOVA model with treatment group and ethnicity and qualification for rescue therapy at Week 12 as fixed effects, baseline value as covariate.

outcome.title: Change of Central Subfield Thickness (CST) on Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT) From Baseline to Week 52
outcome.description: Retinal and lesion characteristics, such as central retinal thickness (CRT), were evaluated by OCT in both eyes at every study visit. CRT was measured using optical coherence tomography to determine the average thickness of the retina in a circle with 1 millimeter of diameter centered on the fovea. This value is reported by some OCT devices as central subfield thickness (CST).
outcome.population: FAS with evaluable subjects for this outcome measure.

group.title: Aflibercept + Sham Photodynamic Therapy (PDT)
group.description: Participants received 2 milligram (mg) Intravitreal aflibercept injection (IAI) (Eylea, VEGF Trap-Eye, BAY86-5321) every month for the first 3 months (run-in period). At Week 12, subjects were randomized to receive Aflibercept injection plus sham photodynamic therapy (only in subjects qualifying for rescue therapy).

group.title: Aflibercept + Active PDT
group.description: Participants received 2 mg Intravitreal aflibercept injection (IAI) (Eylea, VEGF Trap-Eye, BAY86-5321) every month for the first 3 months (run-in period). At Week 12, subjects were randomized to receive Aflibercept injection plus active photodynamic therapy (only in subjects qualifying for rescue therapy) until Week 52. Between Week 52 and Week 96, the treatment interval could have been extended (typically in increments of 1 or 2 weeks) at the discretion of the investigator when the visual and anatomic outcomes allowed

measure.title: Change of Central Subfield Thickness (CST) on Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT) From Baseline to Week 52
measure.description: Retinal and lesion characteristics, such as central retinal thickness (CRT), were evaluated by OCT in both eyes at every study visit. CRT was measured using optical coherence tomography to determine the average thickness of the retina in a circle with 1 millimeter of diameter centered on the fovea. This value is reported by some OCT devices as central subfield thickness (CST).
measure.population: FAS with evaluable subjects for this outcome measure.

analysis.groups_desc: The analysis population included only subjects with values for CST at baseline and Week 52. Baseline values were not carried forward.
analysis.estimate_desc: Point estimate, 95% CI and p-value are based on difference (AFL-sham – AFL-PDT) of LS mean changes using an ANCOVA model with treatment group and ethnicity and qualification for rescue therapy at Week 12 as fixed effects, baseline value as covariate.

outcome.title: Change in National Eye Institute 25-item Visual Function Questionnaire (NEI VFQ-25) Total Score From Baseline to Week 52
outcome.description: The NEI VFQ-25 total score ranges from 0-100 with a score of 0 being the worst outcome and 100 being the best outcome. The NEI VFQ questionnaire is organized as a collection of subscales which are all scored from 0-100. To reach the overall composite score, each sub-scale score is averaged in order to give each sub-scale equal weight.
outcome.population: FAS with evaluable subjects for this outcome measure.

group.title: Aflibercept + Sham Photodynamic Therapy (PDT)
group.description: Participants received 2 milligram (mg) Intravitreal aflibercept injection (IAI) (Eylea, VEGF Trap-Eye, BAY86-5321) every month for the first 3 months (run-in period). At Week 12, subjects were randomized to receive Aflibercept injection plus sham photodynamic therapy (only in subjects qualifying for rescue therapy).

group.title: Aflibercept + Active PDT
group.description: Participants received 2 mg Intravitreal aflibercept injection (IAI) (Eylea, VEGF Trap-Eye, BAY86-5321) every month for the first 3 months (run-in period). At Week 12, subjects were randomized to receive Aflibercept injection plus active photodynamic therapy (only in subjects qualifying for rescue therapy) until Week 52. Between Week 52 and Week 96, the treatment interval could have been extended (typically in increments of 1 or 2 weeks) at the discretion of the investigator when the visual and anatomic outcomes allowed

measure.title: Change in National Eye Institute 25-item Visual Function Questionnaire (NEI VFQ-25) Total Score From Baseline to Week 52
measure.description: The NEI VFQ-25 total score ranges from 0-100 with a score of 0 being the worst outcome and 100 being the best outcome. The NEI VFQ questionnaire is organized as a collection of subscales which are all scored from 0-100. To reach the overall composite score, each sub-scale score is averaged in order to give each sub-scale equal weight.
measure.population: FAS with evaluable subjects for this outcome measure.

analysis.groups_desc: The analysis population included only subjects with values for NEI VFQ-25 score at baseline and Week 52.
analysis.estimate_desc: Point estimate, 95% CI and p-value are based on difference (AFL-sham – AFL-PDT) of LS mean changes using an ANCOVA model with treatment group and ethnicity and qualification for rescue therapy at Week 12 as fixed effects, baseline value as covariate.

outcome.title: Percentage of Subjects for Whom Rescue Therapy is Indicated Over the Course Till Week 52
outcome.description: Evaluations for qualification for rescue were conducted at each visit from Week 12 to Week 52. Intensified aflibercept treatment plus active or sham PDT treatments were given at any of these visits if treatment criteria were met. Qualification for rescue was based upon insufficient gain of BCVA, leakage, and presence of active polyps.
outcome.population: FAS with evaluable subjects for this outcome measure.

group.title: Aflibercept + Sham Photodynamic Therapy (PDT)
group.description: Participants received 2 milligram (mg) Intravitreal aflibercept injection (IAI) (Eylea, VEGF Trap-Eye, BAY86-5321) every month for the first 3 months (run-in period). At Week 12, subjects were randomized to receive Aflibercept injection plus sham photodynamic therapy (only in subjects qualifying for rescue therapy).

group.title: Aflibercept + Active PDT
group.description: Participants received 2 mg Intravitreal aflibercept injection (IAI) (Eylea, VEGF Trap-Eye, BAY86-5321) every month for the first 3 months (run-in period). At Week 12, subjects were randomized to receive Aflibercept injection plus active photodynamic therapy (only in subjects qualifying for rescue therapy) until Week 52. Between Week 52 and Week 96, the treatment interval could have been extended (typically in increments of 1 or 2 weeks) at the discretion of the investigator when the visual and anatomic outcomes allowed

measure.title: Percentage of Subjects for Whom Rescue Therapy is Indicated Over the Course Till Week 52
measure.description: Evaluations for qualification for rescue were conducted at each visit from Week 12 to Week 52. Intensified aflibercept treatment plus active or sham PDT treatments were given at any of these visits if treatment criteria were met. Qualification for rescue was based upon insufficient gain of BCVA, leakage, and presence of active polyps.
measure.population: FAS with evaluable subjects for this outcome measure.

analysis.p_value_desc: The p-value is calculated from the 2-sided Cochran-Mantel-Haenszel test adjusted by ethnicity and qualification for rescue therapy at Week 12.
analysis.estimate_desc: CI is based on the treatment difference in % (AFL-sham – AFL-PDT) using the Mantel-Haenszel weighting scheme adjusted by ethnicity and qualification for rescue therapy at Week 12.

reported_events.time_frame: From start of study treatment up to 30 days after the last treatment. Approximately 100 weeks.
reported_events.desc: The SAF (N=333) included all subjects who received any study drug under this protocol.

group.title: Aflibercept + Sham PDT
group.description: Subjects received 2 milligram (mg) Intravitreal aflibercept injection (IAI) (Eylea, VEGF Trap-Eye, BAY86-5321) every month for the first 3 months (run-in period).At Week 12, subjects were assessed for the rescue treatment and randomized to receive Aflibercept injection plus sham photodynamic therapy (only in subjects qualifying for rescue therapy) until Week 52. Between Week 52 and Week 96, the treatment interval could have been extended (typically in increments of 1 or 2 weeks) at the discretion of the investigator when the visual and anatomic outcomes allowed.

group.title: Aflibercept + Active PDT
group.description: Subjects received 2 mg Intravitreal aflibercept injection (IAI) (Eylea, VEGF Trap-Eye, BAY86-5321) every month for the first 3 months (run-in period). At Week 12, subjects were assessed for the rescue treatment and randomized to receive Aflibercept injection plus active photodynamic therapy (only in subjects qualifying for rescue therapy) until Week 52. Between Week 52 and Week 96, the treatment interval could have been extended (typically in increments of 1 or 2 weeks) at the discretion of the investigator when the visual and anatomic outcomes allowed.

group.title: Aflibercept (Non-randomized)
group.description: Subjects received 2 mg Intravitreal aflibercept injection (IAI) (Eylea, VEGF Trap-Eye, BAY86-5321) every month for the first 3 months (run-in period), but discontinued study participation before randomization.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
